ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: Manas is a mental health organization, working with the goal of providing mental health services to all sections of the society. We work towards enhancing the supply of mental health services while also working towards generating demand for the same. Our awareness campaigns, active advocacy and lobbying with various stakeholders works towards generating demand for mental health services, and also helps in reducing the shame and stigma attached towards accessing mental health services. Direct delivery of services, training programmes for professionals in the field of psychology, paraprofessionals and barefoot counsellors help in providing effective services to various sections. Our plugin model of mental health believes in incorporating mental health services into any existing model of delivery that is serving a section of society. Through this model we use existing delivery systems to reach out to vulnerable sections of the society cost effectively and efficiently. People living with HIV/AIDS, MSM groups, slum populations, women covered under RCH programme, students in schools and colleges and disadvantaged youth serviced by various CSOs are some of the groups that have been targeted through this approach. In the area of gender, we specially work with target populations that consistently come in contact with women, like commercial vehicle drivers, police and health workers and sensitise them to make women comfortable in accessing these services, while in the long run working towards gender equity and reducing violence. Lastly, youth and adolescents, both mainstream and disadvantaged, form a special focus of our work. We work towards ensuring that preventive measures are taken to reduce the occurrence of psychological disorders among the target population. This work also involves early identification and redressal in situation where psychological problems have developed. Mental health sensitization of concerned stakeholders as well as skill enhancement for identification and first aid redressal work towards sustainability of our endeavours.

ngoList.title: Manav Propkari sanstha
ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: Manav Paropkari Sanstha is a Registered NGO that has been involved in various social activities for the last two decades . Our organization is working in the field of women upliftment and prevention of Drug de-addiction particularly in the weaker section of the society. We have a working experience for providing comprehensive professional consultancy services, empowerment of women and child welfare, free medical services to older persons, for all facets of drug abuse prevention and treatment, public awareness camps, monitoring and evaluation, preliminary and detailed investigations & various development projects .Since its inception, the society has been functioning through establishing linkages or networking with other government organizations. With our wide range of expertise, we offer solutions to our clients by adding value at every stage of project. The organization started working with women and children more than two decade ago in various vocational training to different categories of women. The organization provides a full range of professional services in various sectors and is backed by a team of dedicated and highly qualified staffs to organize awareness program and other activities. Project Achievements: Since the inception of the Drug de-addiction cum Rehabilitation projects. we have got a great achievements to Rehabilitate the addict through treatment .We have given approx. 38500 beneficiaries OPD service and Approx. 15000 beneficiaries Indoor treatment from last 16 years . Our staff provide Individual counseling, Group counseling, Family counseling and come to know the whereabouts of the beneficiaries, how he become an addict . and motivate the beneficiaries to live drug free life and describe drug is commonly defined as harmful for health. Continuous misuse of such drugs can lend to poor health and behavior problem. we have organized awareness programmes that involves the family,schools, communities and the media in reducing drug abuse. We treated the beneficiaries through vehicle which we use for whole person recovery.

ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: Mobile Creches works with the children in the birth Ã¢â‚¬â€œ 12 years age group, living on the construction sites & slums of Delhi (NCR). Our experience on ground, strengthens our voice to advocate for policy change. Till date, weÃ¢â‚¬â„¢ve reached out to 7,50,000 children, trained 6,500 women as childcare workers, run 650 daycare centres & partnered with 200 builders. Our training and advocacy efforts cover most of the North Indian belt. Mobile Creches is one of the few organizations that have been pioneering the cause of Early Child Care and development (ECCD). What sets Mobile Creches apart from other organizations working with children is our dual focus on the young child under 6 years in the urban slums and the migrant child, up to 14 years, on construction sites. We adopt multiple approaches for reaching the child at construction sites- providing direct daycare services; facilitating the builder to set up the services, while we provide the training and monitoring; and training and monitoring other NGOs to set up daycare services. At the urban slums, we train community women in daycare and provide support to enable them to provide quality daycare services, and also raise awareness about the need for childcare and help the community access government services. The multi-pronged approach adopted by Mobile Creches Ã¢â‚¬â€œ working with construction workersÃ¢â‚¬â„¢ children; working with urban slum communities; training and advocacy Ã¢â‚¬â€œ encompasses both the short term need and a long term vision.

ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: Model Rural Youth Development Organization (MRYDO) is a registered voluntary organization under the Societies Registration Act, 1860. It was established in the year 1986 by a group of dedicated youth having experience in social development. The organizational vision is to contribute towards an inclusive society based on social justice, equality, non-discrimination and self reliance where all people live a life with dignity. The Organization runs as per the requirements under the Societies Registration Act. It has a Governing body, Executive Committee and General Body. The organization believes in working through a democratic and participatory process. Participation of people in all aspects of organization functioning and management is a core principle. In the early days, the organization was engaged with promoting awareness raising and implementing targeted development programmes for women, children, youth and other vulnerable categories of people on a small scale. During the initial stages all the work that was carried out on a voluntary basis. The funds for project activities were mobilized from individual contributions from team members and donations from public. The need for financial resources to undertake development activities at the grassroots level is quite high while the organizational funds mobilized were quite low. It was felt that the organization needed to work on a professional basis. External funds were felt necessary to support the ongoing developmental work from Government and other donors. Fundraising initiatives were undertaken on a professional basis and project proposals were developed and submitted to various developmental actors including Government, like-minded INGOs, Foundations and Corporates. The organization was successful in mobilizing external funding based on its strengths of the organization in managing funds and implementing programmes on a professional basis, rapport with relevant stakeholders including excluded communities. To realize the organizational vision, mission and goals, the development work focused on working with targeted reference communities including marginalized youth, women and children and their associations. Rights based approach of work is a core principle. The thematic areas of work included women empowerment, education, health, water & sanitation and vocational training of youth. MRYDO has developed innovative ways of working with excluded communities over the years under different social development projects. The organization has worked extensively on issues pertaining to formation and strengthening of self help groups, health, Tuberculosis, awareness generation on women and child rights and work on issues relating to HIV and AIDS and drug abuse. Bank linkages of reference communities with nationalized banks have been facilitated over the years. The organization has developed systems and processes to ensure a professional way of functioning to ensure transparency and accountability at all levels. The Organization has been recognized by the Government and donors as a resource agency contributing towards development of poor and marginalized people in Delhi, Haryana and Punjab. MRYDO is a part of state and national level issue-based campaigns with other like-minded voluntary organizations and other developmental actors. Over the years, many developmental activities have been initiated with the support from various government agencies and like-minded donors. The various resource and funding organizations include nationalized banks, Government line departments, Mission Convergence, DOTS, DSACS and international donors like WaterAid and other Foundations.

ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: Mokshda PEVSS is an ISO 9001:2000 certified non-profit charitable NGO registered under the Societies Registration Act 1860. We have been engaged in energy and environment conservation activities under the aegis of the Ministry of Environment & Forests (MoEF) since last 17 years. One of our major thrust areas of work is introduction of energy efficient wood based cremation system in the hitherto neglected cremation sector. With our extensive surveys and public contact programs at more than 1100 cremation grounds and a focused research and development programme, we have developed energy-efficient and environment-friendly Mokshda Green Cremation System (MGCS). MGCS operates traditionally on wood and is capable of reducing wood consumption up to 75% as compared to the conventional method of cremation. It also helps in minimizing air and water pollution. As a result of much lesser wood burning MGCS helps stabilizing GHG emissions from cremation sector. The technology has been supported by MoEF and a number of local bodies across the country. A GEF project of 60 units of MGCS for 10 important cities of India has also been approved with cost sharing in the ratio of 30:60:10 amongst GEF/UNDP, MoEF and concerned local bodies respectively. Public awareness mainly through schools and colleges is another focused area of Mokshda PEVSS. An activity viz. School and College Awareness Programme on Environment (SCAPE) was started in 2005. A large number of schools of Delhi and NCR and Mumbai have been covered under this programme. Topics related to various aspects of environment and energy conservation, screening of related documentary films, exhibitions, painting and drawing competitions, debates, etc. are the main activities taken up under SCAPE. Participation in India International Trade Fair (IITF), New Delhi in collaboration of the Ministry of Environment & Forests, is another regular activity focused at sensitizing and educating public about the government conservation programmes of rivers and lakes and how with peopleÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s participation such programmes could be made sustainable. Mokshda PEVSS has been regularly organizing mega events like the World Environment Day (June 5) and the International Earth Day (April 22) to sensitize students and public about the latest developments in the field of energy and environment conservation. A Souvenir containing articles from eminent writers and environmentalists, students, teachers, etc. is released on the occasion of the World Environment Day. The Souvenir is widely circulated amongst central / state government departments and organizations, urban local bodies, reputed NGOs, schools and colleges across the country. A number of plantation drives have been organized by us in collaboration with Environment and Forests Departments of State Governments and various public / private enterprises. The last programme under this activity was active participation in the drives organized by the Department of Environment, Government of Delhi at Garhi Mandu on the occasions of the World Environment Day and the International Biological Diversity Day. Chief Minister, Delhi steered both these programmes. A project for plantation of 1000 trees in Gurgaon in collaboration with a private sector company is to be started shortly. The other areas where Mokshda PEVSS has been working are sustainable sewage treatment systems with public-private partnership, sustainable municipal solid waste management, ground-water recharge and rain-water harvesting, recycling of waste water, public awareness programs and use of IT in environment protection and monitoring activities.
